thread.title: Real Madrid 3-1 Napoli player ratings: Casemiro stars as Los Blancos seal two-goal first-leg lead
thread.title_full: Real Madrid 3-1 Napoli player ratings: Casemiro stars as Los Blancos seal two-goal first-leg lead - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: Real Madrid 3-1 Napoli player ratings: Casemiro stars as Los Blancos seal two-goal first-leg lead
text:
Real Madrid 3-1 Napoli player ratings: Casemiro stars as Los Blancos seal two-goal first-leg lead Karim Benzema, Toni Kroos and Casemiro were on target for Los Blancos to cancel out Lorenzo Insigne's opener for the visitors Share Comments By Jack Rathborn 21:50, 15 FEB 2017 Updated 21:57, 15 FEB 2017 Sport Casemiro celebrates his stunning volley (Photo: Angel Martinez / Real Madrid CF) Real Madrid CF Real Madrid put one foot in the last eight of the Champions League with a 3-1 victory over Napoli at the Bernabeu.
Lorenzo Insigne fired the visitors into a surprise early lead from all of 40 yards, catching out Real goalkeeper Keylor Navas.
Karim Benzema drew Los Blancos level before the break before Toni Kroos struck early in the second half to put Real in front.
Casemiro's stunning volley was enough to seal a two-goal cushion for Zinedine Zidane's side heading back to Italy.
The Brazilian midfielder was our man Jack Rathborn's man of the match, but who caught your eye in Madrid?
Here are the full player ratings...
Read More Real Madrid 3-1 Napoli: Benzema, Kroos and Casemiro put Los Blancos on cusp of last eight - 5 things we learned Real Madrid Navas 4 - Shocking positioning for the goal, bailed out by his teammates. Quick off his line to deny Mertens when he occasionally got in behind Varane.
Insigne caught Navas out early in the piece (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Carvajal 6 - Sleeping as Insigne's quick movement was found by Hamsik for the opener. His cross for Benzema's goal was super with the outside of his boot. Mixed night.
Ramos 5 - Not comfortable with Napoli's lack of presence in the central areas up top. Limped off in the second half.
Varane 5 - Struggled to contain Mertens when he dropped deep and pulled him out of position.
Marcelo 5 - Got forward well but left his side exposed at times with Callejon's movement in behind. Missed a glorious chance to make it four late on.
Kroos 7 - Excellent game, picked out James with a sublime pass and a neat finish from Ronaldo's cut-back put the hosts in front.
Kroos celebrates his strike (Photo: Getty) Modric 6 - Quiet night, few close shots but took a back seat to Kroos and Casemiro for the most part.
Casemiro 8 MOM - Scored with a thunderbolt of a shot on the volley to ensure a memorable evening.
James 5 - Failed to grasp a rare starting opportunity. Failed to beat Reina when put through on goal.
Benzema 7 - Could have had a couple more, but his header and constant movement caused Napoli big problems.
Ronaldo 6 - Wasteful in front of goal but his assist was excellent for Kroos' goal.
Napoli Reina 6 - Made one outstanding save to prevent Benzema from giving the hosts an early lead.
Reina floors Benzema (Photo: REUTERS) Hysaj 5 - Got forward well and offers a calm influence in possession when Napoli look to play quick, one-touch passes. But too often was static and exposed by Real.
Albiol 6 - Tough night with Benzema's movement causing him real trouble. Last ditch tackle late on pushes his rating up.
Koulibaly 6 - Brought the ball out well and made a couple of headed clearances to keep Napoli just about alive.
Ghoulam 4 - Ronaldo had his way with him when he was given the return ball in behind.
Zielinski 5 - Lively early on but wilted when Real got themselves in front.
Diawara 6 - Calm in possession during Napoli's good moments, a tremendous talent, but naturally struggled to impose himself against Real's elite midfield in the second half.
Ronaldo takes on the defence (Photo: REUTERS) Hamsik 5 - Missed a good chance with his left in the first half, failing to hit the target at the near post.
Callejon 6 - Saw plenty of the ball down the right but failed to expose Marcelo's advanced position. Goal ruled out after he failed to time his run to the back post.
Mertens 5 - Isolated, but dropped in and spun to offer a danger in behind. Missed a glorious chance to make it 3-2. Would have created the second goal had Callejon timed his run to be onside before finishing.
Insigne 7 - Scored a sumptuous opener from distance with intelligence to spot Navas out of position.
